This port is like going to the zoo only to find out all the animals are dead. I was excited because MM2 is one of my favorites and even after having read the bad reviews I was hoping that it was just a bunch of whiney Karens. This time everyone was correct, this game is awful. The controls are trash and the frame rate is embarrassingly slow. The face looks good but the body looks like 100 miles of bad road. Try again please. It doesn't have to end like this.

The frame rate absolutely makes the game hard to play. I'm using a Samsung Galaxy S9, a modern, powerful smartphone! I can run 3D games effortlessly on this thing such as GTA San Andreas. Either Mega Man 2 (A 2D game from 1988, which originally released on the NES) is a very demanding game, or the game isn't well optimized for smartphones and/or has a bad emulator. There is no option to fix this. What I read from other reviews is this is apparently a common issue. I hope this gets fixed.
Great game limited by the lousy controls.
Crappy implementation of a great game.
Alien wily too easy
Great QoL changes over the originals in exchange for choppy frame rate.
I love the game since I was a kid but the controls really take out the fun and really bring out the frustration. Please do something about it
Quick man is impossible even with time stopper

Capcom, I know you can do better than that, and considering the example has been presented for you in the forms of NES, SNES, and GBA emulators, you could do WAY better. Immediately, what pissed me off was the frame rate, and the condensed screen size. Everytime you move, the game blinks as you move across the screen. I know it has something to do with being a port, but.... coming out of professionals, I'd still expect better. The audio quality was solid, but control scheme was garbo.
Terrible port that runs very poorly.
Bee better game with blue tooth enabled but good the controls need to be fixed with blue tooth be a lot a better game ill give blue tooth controls a five star with blue tooth
Controls such, no controller support. Bad port overal too
I did like the game the Robot Masters were harder than I expected in the first

One of my favourite NES games I grew up with as a kid, this terrible port just wasnt the same for me. The in-game difficulty has been greatly reduced (took only slightly over 1 hour to get to Wilys final alien form.) only for it to be replaced by absolutely awful controls and frame rate, I'd prefer a games challenging aspect to be the game play not the in game controls. Game controls make wily's alien form impossible without E-tanks Mega man as a whole gets a 5/5. This awful port gets a 1/5.

Awesome and fun
It's cool like a NES classic game
The controls are nothing amazing, but still good, I liked this game, but I ragequit at the first wily stage. Yes i'm that bad.

It's nice to have a version of megaman on your phone but it is just filled with issues that make it a pain to play. Controls leave much to be desired, the game lags constantly, some parts are basicly impossible because of the control scheme. Overall a decent game but just to problem riddled to be a good game.
It would be a better experience if you could reposition the D pad and buttons. I enjoyed the game and the nostalgia.

Exactly what you expect from a mobile mega man. The gameplay is fantastic and an incredible platformer on console. On mobile the game is laggy and poor controls but there are slight tweaks to the game so that these issues are manageable. Definitely not the best way to play mega man 2 but a really cool game to own on mobile

I bought the first megaman on the phone and had a blast. I have heard rumours from my gamer brethren about the ungodly game megaman 2 with the best music in the world. So i bought it and yet again made myself a guide for the game. I knew it was much harder than the original i mastered but i accepted the challenge. In only 2 days i beat both normal and hard mode yippie. It was a great game and it lived up to its name. Me being so good at the first didnt really give me a chance to enjoy this one:(

its a horrible port of a really old game km surprised it runs this bad.

What a waste!! I spent the first 5 seconds crying from nostalgia, but asked for refund after 1 minute of actual gameplay! My god the app is poorly optimized, I can run 3D photorealistic graphics on my phone but this game manages to move 25 years old low res sprites at 5 frames per second TOP. Sad
Without a doubt the best Mega Man game in the series! Responsive controls, fair difficulty, best robot designs, and a great soundtrack! A true classic!
Poorly optimised, this app needs to be scrapped and rebuilt from the ground up. Get rid of the horrible controls. refunded.

Haven't had any frame rate issues or slow music as some of the other people here have. Really the only problem I have is that it doesn't have controller support. It's such a simple thing that would have made it a five star port! Please Capcon add that feature to the game!
Big megaman/Rockman fan.. bought 1-6 just to have them, but game is hard with touch screen controls need bluetooth support. Still a must have if your a fan.

Much like my review with MM 1. It still plays like a Megaman Game. MM2 is what many people consider to be the difinitive entry. but for me the series only gets better and better. MM2 introduces E tanks, The 8 Robot Masters. and the grafics have more veriety and detail. again not the BEST entrie but i enjoyed it more then 1.

This was a very difficult game on the NES that required a great deal of precision. On a phone, it's soooooo much harder because the controls are not nearly as precise as they would be with a real controller.
One of the best nes games.
I love meat man 2, it's the best. This is a terrible version of it. I've an s8 and it looks like I'm playing on a device 10 years old. Much better off emulating it :(

These ports are actively encouraging piracy. How do you screw up a 30 year old game this bad? The scrolling is choppy, the controls are laggy, and, when you die, THE CHECKPOINTS ARE GONE! I'm playing through Air Man's stage and I miss a jump later in the level. Now, I know this game very well, I should've respawned halfway through the level, but no, I go to a Game Over screen on my first life, and then when I chose to continue, back to the start of the level I go! I can download an emulator and some ROMs and get genuine traditional classic gameplay, but no, I had to support Capcom, and they F*** UP MEGA MAN 2! It's awful!

I've been playing mega man since its 1st debut I'm a huge fan but I can honestly say this mobile version is dissapointing choppy animation and terrible controls kill the enjoyment right out if the game theres a game called Rockbot1 that plays alot better then this. I'm almost kinda pissed I spend $2.00 on this game.
Airman, metal man, veteran! GT gt... ;)

It's Mega Man 2 on a phone. The controls are not as good without a controller, but that's to be expected. My only complaint is that there is a game-breaking glitch in this version: if you beat any part of Dr. Wily's castle and then quit, when you continue, you're stuck in an infinite loop of the first part of his castle over and over again. WHEN YOU START THE CASTLE, YOU MUST BEAT THE GAME WITHOUT QUITTING AND RELOADING.

These games r so easy I beet every mega man game they ever had

Ive been playing Mega Man games since the mid 80s and I was really happy to see mobile versions of the first 6 . My main problem is that its next to impossible for me to not accidentally tap the back button on my phone causing the game to go to its menu screen. Its very irritating though i cant really blame the game i guess. I also had to adapt to a different playing style due to touch screen as opposed to a nes or ps2 controllers that ive used in the past for Mega Man games. Its been quite challenging.
Pretty good. Maybe tighten the controls a bit.

Fun game and will always love Mega Man. But the frame rate is horrible (theme for all 6) at times you need it to be smooth. Game is about timing jumps and shots and thats hard to do when you can't see the shots. Need to add controller support as well as Android TV support.
Couldn't beat any boss due to choppy framerate and noticeable lag
Unplayable in my opinion. Megaman moves with 5-10fps on my LG G5. I can run shadowgun at max settings, so this is just a bad port
Disappointed
How is this 8-bit game barely able to play on my phone but I can play any other game no problem? I hope there's a fix soon

Terrible frame rate makes it extremely hard to play. Can't accurately time jumps/attacks and it honestly just feels bad. I'm running Android 6.0.1 with 6GB RAM and the minimum requirements state Android 4.0 1GB RAM. I guess that's what you should expect from a $2 mobile port though. Edit: I tried it on "High." It was still terrible. Still one star; still would definitely not recommend.
replyContent: You might try the fast mode.  It might feel a little better to you.

content: Terrible frame rate. This game is unplayable

I was so excited to see this ported over. I even Googled to see which version of Megaman would be the best possibly. I settled for Megaman 2. To my disappointment the frame rate was low and choppy. It makes for a really bad experience playing the game at all. I could not stand more than five minutes of the game play. Unfortunately I did not try the game until later in the afternoon so I missed out on my refund ability. This is on a Nexus 6P. Please fix it! At this point I hear emulators are better than this.
The game is great. But i recommend one thing to fix can you make the default speed to high so that people stop complaining about the frame rate.
Works fine on Nvidia Shield Tablet
I have a S7 so it shouldn't have a problem running a bloody 8Bit game yet i have such terrible fps. I would buy it again if the fps was fixed.
YES!!!!! hopefully it works with a bluetooth gamepad was a little rough getting through Airman's stage and defeating Flashman

Wow does this port suck! I bought MM 3 and 6 and they were fine, but this one is almost unplayable (even on fast mode). I died about a dozen times on three stages and used to beat this game without losing a single life. Impossible to shoot diagonally and jumps are delayed a bit.
I was actually going to refund it but missed the deadline. Not happy with the cintrols or framesrate. Especially disappointed that it had no bt controller support or 16x9.
It's a shame Capcom released this. Don't bother with it unless they fix it
Excelent game, very good controls, but frame drop kills everything and couldn't enjoy it
replyContent: Thanks for the kind works. We're looking into the framerate issues.

content: The frame rate is really bad. The controls aren't that great either.
replyContent: Thanks for your support.  We'll do what we can to make the game better.

content: I've played thru MegaMan 2 countless times and despite frame rate/control issues, this version is fun, especially considering the price.
replyContent: Many thanks for the kind words.

content: No frame rate issues here.
Bad port do not buy, bad frame rate.
replyContent: Consider trying fast mode. It might play a little better for you.

content: It's playable, but the framerate is really bad, which can cause you to get hit by attacks you couldn't even see. Along with that, most of the text now uses a new font that is extremely jarring and out of place. In it's current state, I would not recommend these ports. Instead, just get MM Legacy Collection on Steam, PS4, XB1, or 3DS.

The controls are actually fantastic and the audio is delicious, but the frame rate ruins the experience. Playing it on Google Pixel. Update: changing speed to high made the game much more playable! Fame rate could still be a bit smoother.
The frame issues we're minimal, and it did have to chug, but all in all its just MEGA MAN on Mobile. And it's an good port for the android phone.
My favorite mega man game!!

Have played this series since the very beginning. Would've loved to enjoy this on yet another platform, but the bad frame rate makes the game unplayable, which is essential on any platformer, more importantly on a Mega Man game.
replyContent: Consider playing it in fast mode. Some players think it feels better.
